WorkItem.Description:
I am having problems with the RibbonWindow from the new WPF ribbon release.
 
It does not always display properly as shown in the attached screenshot.  Once the screen is minimized and then maximized again, it displays fine.
 
Has anyone else had this problem?  As a workaround, I have had to use the standard Window instead of RibbonWindow, which is not ideal.
 
N.B.  I am running Windows 7 64 bit, in 32 bit mode, and have some win forms controls on the main window.

Comments.Message:
When is this happening? Like when you try to resize, move the window around or as soon as it renders? 
Also can you try the scenario with glass effect turned off?
for me it happens as soon as it renders.

I have attached a simple project to illustrate the problem.  (Note that I am running it on Windows7 64 bit in x86 Release configuration)
I have not had time to determine whether the problem lies in the Ribbon or the docking framework, however I do know that when I change RibbonWindow to Window, everything works as expected.

The problem occurs as soon as the main window opens.

Thanks, John

Thank you for the repro app. This seems to be a known issue and we are actively working on its resolution. We have it in our internal database. Mean while, are you seeing this issue with software acceleration too? I think this happens usually on hardware acceleration only.

As requested, I tried turning off hardware acceleration (via code) and the problem no longer occurs.

John
